Taurus family of semi-auto pistols now feature the Taurus Security System, which provides instant-ready defense with built-in ability to secure your pistol and make it inoperable at the turn of a key. When the Security System is engaged, the pistol cannot be fired or cocked and the gun's manual safety cannot be disengaged. As with our revolver Security System, the device is part of the firearm and cannot be lost, and the same special Security Key works for both the revolver and pistol Systems (two keys come with each gun). To engage: simply insert the Key into the button on the rear or side of the pistol and rotate one-quarter turn clockwise. This engages the Security System. The manual safety cannot be moved and the trigger cannot be pulled. To disengage: simply rotate the key one-quarter turn back. This releases the Security System, yet leaves the pistol's manual safety in the "safe" position until you are ready to release it yourself and fire the gun.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Madsen Model 47   30-06 REDUCED
postcontent:
This is a very clean Rifle 95% of the arsenal black finish, Mechanically excellent 30.06 / Walnut finish/ Armed Forces of Columbia. 

Madsen model 1947 rifle, also know as "the MADSEN Lightweight Military Rifle" or "Colombian Navy M1958 rifle", was designed and manufactured by Dansk Industrie Sindikat "Madsen" A.S., mostly to be offered for 3rd world countries, whose armies had not enough funds to buy and maintain semi- or full-automatic infantry rifles. This rifle was first offered in DISA / Madsen catalogs in 1947, but initially found no buyers, as world arms markets were flooded with surplus rifles of the WW2 era, and the focus of military interests shifted from bolt action rifles towards semi-automatic and automatic rifles. In 1958 Colombian Navy made an order for Madsen Model 1947 rifles in caliber .30-06 US. Total production of the  Madsen model 1947 rifles is estimated at around 5-6 thousands rifles. The Madsen model 1947 rifle is often called 'the last military bolt action rifle', as it was designed and manufactured when bolt-action rifles finally became obsolete as standard military rifles.

The Madsen model 1947 rifle is manually operated bolt action rifle. It uses rotary bolt action with dual locking lugs, located at the rear of the bolt body. Bolt lugs engage cuts, made on the inner receiver walls just behind the magazine housing. The cocking handle is located at the middle of the bolt and bent down for more comfortable carry. Manual safety is located at the rear of the bolt, and has two position. When it points to the left, rifle is ready to fire; when it points up, rifle is set to 'safe', it cannot fire and bolt is locked. Rifle is fed from integral, non-detachable box magazine that holds 5 rounds. Magazine is reloaded from the top, when the bolt is opened, using single rounds or stripper clips. Sighting equipment consist of the protected front sight and aperture type rear sight, which is adjustable for windage and range between 100 and 900 meters. To decrease felt recoil of the rifle, it is equipped with integral muzzle brake and a rubber buttplate.

title: For Sale:  BARRETT REC7 PISTON 6.8 Leupold
postcontent:
The Barrett Enhanced Bolt is made from high-strength 9310 steel. The bolt is designed specifically for use in the piston operated REC7, not just adapted from a direct gas bolt. The bolt’s gas-ring-free design is easy to clean. Reinforced at critical areas, every bolt is proofed and magnetic-particle inspected to guarantee reliable performance.

At the heart of the operating system is a nitrided, two-position, forward-venting gas plug that retains the piston. The piston can be accessed through the front of the gas block without removing the handguard so optical sights or laser devices do not need to be zeroed after routine maintenance.

The REC7 rifle’s forged 7075 aluminum upper and lower receivers are Type 3 hardcoat anodized. The lower houses an ultra-dependable single-stage trigger. The upper supports a free-floated, hammer-forged, chrome-lined barrel with M4 feed ramps machined into the receiver and the barrel extension. A mil-spec A2 flash hider protects the muzzle.

In 5.56 NATO and 6.8 SPC, the REC7 is everything you’d expect from a Barrett rifle, and then some.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Electronic Dog Training Collar
postcontent:
Remote control pet training collar uses transmitter/receiver system to send sound and/or static shock signals to alert and train your dog. Trainer can select a choice of 3 tone signals or 8 levels of humane static shock stimulation. New in Box. . . . tested for proper operation. 

I used one of these collars to train my dog to stay on my property even though I have no fences.  As she approached the property line I transmitted several beeps (only had to use the shock mode three times). She learned that the "beep" was the signal to come back. I can now let her run free without the training collar and she stays within my property line.  

Features: 
+ Range up to 200 meters
+ Multiple Tone Signals used to send your dog different audio training commands.
+ 8 levels of Static Stimulation (from mild to an increasing tingling sensation) to correct your pet's behavior
+ High-tech computer program technology
+ Lightweight and water resistant transmitter and receiver
+ Batteries and Instructions Included

+ Three different audio tones for training your dog. When used with verbal commands, your dog soon recognizes the individual sound signals and what they mean. 

Example: 1 beep = turn left; 2 beeps = turn right;  3 beeps = come back.

+ Eight different levels of static shock stimulation available to correct the behavior of your dog. 

Example:  Press red button for 3 beeps. . if dog does not respond, press white button number 2 for a static shock and re-press red button again for 3 beeps. If dog still does not respond, press white button number 3 or 4 and then re-press red button for 3 beeps.

Transmitter Specifications: 
+ Height: 8.5  inches (with antenna extended)
+ Width: 1.75  inches
+ Thickness: 1 inch
+ Transmitter uses one 9 volt battery
+ Red LED lights when a transmitter button is activated
+ Transmits signals up to 200 meters under optimal conditions
+ Frequency: The remote signal runs on 433.92 MHz 
+ Tone command buttons (3 each) are red
+ Static stimulation buttons (8 each) are white 

Receiver Specifications: 
+ Height: 1.25 inches
+ Width: 2.75 inches 
+ Thickness: 1.25 inches
+ Uses one common 6 Volt camera battery (4LR44, 476A, A544, V4034PX, or PX28A)
+ Red LED light serves as low battery indicator
+ The included collar can be adjusted up to 15 inches. 
+ The receiver unit can be installed on a smaller or larger collar if needed. 

In addition to trades I accept cash, USPS Money Orders or PayPal.  Shipping available.

IF INTERESTED AND YOU WANT AN ANSWER, PLEASE SEND AN EMAIL WITH YOUR NAME and TELEPHONE NUMBER.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Smith and Wesson SS 639 9mm
location: Littleton / Castle Rock / Lakewood, Denver, Colorado
postcontent:
Stainless Steel Smith and Wesson Model #639.  This is the single stack ( narrower ) version for easier concealed carry.  Clean condition, light surface scratches, flawless shooter.  Fully adjustable rear sight with fixed front sight, very accurate with an exceptional trigger. If you have never shot one of these Smith and Wesson “wonder 9's” you are missing out. The trigger pull is smooth and consistent on DA, reset is very short and positive for improved feel as well as increased accuracy and better trigger control.  The SA is very light and short; easily one of the best triggers available; second only to nicer 1911's.   This gun has the DA / SA option for your first shot and then SA there after. The safety is slide mounted on the strong side which is easily reached with your thumb and also serves as a  decocker.  Takedown is similar to 1911's and has full length guide rod. The barrel is shiny and the rifling is very good. These guns are known for exceptional reliability and the ability to feed almost any kind of factory ammo. Fun shooter that is economical, dependable, and good for both concealed carry and fun at the range.  Comes with 4 mags and 3 sets of grips.  $450 Cash / Reasonable offer.  Lowballers will be ignored.

Local sales, FTF, legal to own, I will ask to see CO D.L. or CCW

I make rifle slings, survival bracelets, dog collars, and keychains all in 550 7 strand paracord.

bracelets start at $7 for up to 2 colors. $9 for three colors.

title: For Sale:  Kel-Tec PF9 package - many extras
location: Stuart - Martin County, Florida, United States
postcontent:
Have a PF9 up for trade or sale. About 3 months old. Quite possibly the best carry gun made. Super thin and light.

Done a few things to the gun to improve it. A Kel-Tec is meant to be "finished" by the owner for the most part. All modifications are easily reversible but I doubt you'd want to.

**This gun shoots MUCH nicer than a stock factory gun.**

- Fluff and Buffed. Gun has been broken down and deburred. Slide rails and feed ramp smoothed. Hammer surface smoothed

- Trigger straightened, softened and shortened. Biggest complaint with this gun is the trigger shape from the factory can "pinch" larger fingers. The shorter trigger is MUCH more controllable and softer to shoot. A stock replacement trigger is about 2 bucks from Kel-Tec.

- Hogue grip installed and trimmed. Helps suck up the recoil and improve grip on this little beast.

- +1 extended magazine bottom not only adds a round but vastly improves the gun grip.

- Extra +1 magazine. Any defensive gun needs an extra mag. It also has the +1 extension

- Stainless belt clip. Not installed in the pictures but included. Here is a pic of one installed (mine is stainless, not black)

http://imgur.com/gTW0w (not my gun)

Installation is very simple 2 screws.

- Sights and hammer painted orange. For some reason the white sights and my eyes did not play nicely. Orange is MUCH easier to see and get on target with. Orange hammer means it is much easier to stage the trigger (along with the shortened trigger) for fast accurate shots. Both are "painted" with my 5 year olds orange nail polish. It's the type that doesn't need remover. Just "peels" off with a toothpick if you don't dig orange. You will though.

- Shimmed rear site. Gun was accurate but this shooter always trended a touch low with it. You may be different. Shim is just a plastic spacer that you can remove if you shoot differently than I do. I'm no marksman.

- Deburred the grip. Has some ridges on it from the factory that can hurt your hands after awhile. An hour with an emery board really smoothed things out.



Also included:

Flat magazine floor plate.

Pinky magazine floor plate (doesn't add a round)

Allen wrench for sight adjustment

Kel-Tec plastic case

Instruction booklets



Not included but possible for the right deal:

Desantis Soft Tuck holster

Uncle Mikes pocket holster



Looking for a compact 9MM such as a Glock 26 or Ruger SR9c. The Kel-Tec is too small for what I need it for now and I have another gun when I need something smaller. Will add cash as needed to the right deal.



A trade is preferred but will sell outright for $360. This is what everything would cost you if you can even find it all plus you'd have to pay tax and shipping.

FTF bill of sale. DL or CWL required.

Additional photos available on request.

title: For Sale:  Springfield XDM 40 Compact with Bunches of Ammo
location: Raleigh, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
I really thought I'd be keeping this one. I'm not. I had wanted to get a threaded 357 Sig barrel to drop in this and throw a suppressor on it. Turns out, it is nearly impossible to get one for less than $300 so I'm going in a different direction. Only 50 rounds through it.

That being said, this is one of the finest guns I've ever owned. I bought it new from Springfield so it has all paperwork, box and XD gear that it shipped with. It is capable of having drop in barrel conversions which is nice. It is a 3.8" barrel that is astonishingly accurate from reasonable pistol distance. I couldn't believe it. The XDM is a very special pistol. It has a match grade barrel, aggressive molding and some mean slide serrations. Great shooter, confident carry gun. 

Included with this gun will be an Alexap IWB Horsehide Holster that I have carried the gun in for the week or so that I've had it. I am looking to get $550 for the gun, all accessories and the holster.

Since I won't be shooting 40 anymore, I have a whole heap of ammo to go too. 400 rounds of various ammo -- 

200 rounds of Federal 180 grain FMJ's
50 rounds of PMC Bronze 180 grain FMJ's
100 rounds of Remington UMC 180 grain JHP's
50 rounds of Federal 180 grain HST JHP's (XM40HC)

Looking to get $150 for all of the ammo. Won't sell it separately unless the pistol sells first. 

If you buy everything, I'll let it go for $675. Looking to do a deal in Raleigh or I will ship it to your FFL at your expense. This gun must be transferred through a FFL since I bought it through my FFL. I usually use North Raleigh Guns, they charge a $10 transfer fee which is cheaper than I've found elsewhere.

Double/Single action provides a very safe and timeproven design. High-capacity steel magazines are durable and drop-free when the magazine button is depressed, even when empty. Chrome-lined barrels provide extreme corrosion resistance, as well as ease of cleaning. Barrels also feature a deeply recessed combat muzzle crown to protect the rifling. INOX version.
. Open Slide Design: Open top slide virtually eliminates jamming and stove piping. Allows the user to load and chamber one cartridge at a time should the  magazine be lost or damaged.
. Disassembly Latch: Simplifies field stripping for maintenance by allowing quick and easy disassembly. Stays on the gun, preventing accidental dropping and loss. 
. Visible Automatic Firing Pin Block: The front par t of the firing pin is blocked from any forward movement until the trigger is pulled completely back. The block is located rearward, far away from the fouling and debris of the breech face. Since the block is visible, the user may ascer tain its proper operation at any time. Even if the pistol falls and strikes the ground muzzle down, the firing pin will not strike the primer.
. Rear Sight Profile: The rear sight is designed to provide a front projection so that in an emergency, the user may retract the slide single-handedly by pushing the rear sight against the edge of a table, door, etc.
. External Hammer Design: A traditional feature of Beretta pistols, this design provides the energy to the firing pin, virtually eliminating the possibility of misfires due to light primer. Also provides an immediate visual and tactile indicator as to the cocked/uncocked status of the pistol.
. Light Aluminum Frame: Each pistol features a lightweight, forged frame made from extremely strong aircraft-quality aluminum alloy.
. Reversible Magazine Release: Positioned next to the trigger guard for either right or left-handed shooters, allowing rapid reloading. Magazine drops clear when released.
. Unique Ultra Safe Design: The ambidextrous safety lever, easily accessible by the thumb of a right or left handed shooter, is spring loaded so it’s either positively “on” or “off ”. The safety lever also functions as the pistol’s decocking lever. When pushed down, the rear part of the firing pin (striker) is rotated out of alignment with the front part of the firing pin. Additional hammer drop catch (half-cock notch prevents striking of the firing pin unit) in the remote chance of unintentional hammer drop.
. Sure, Firm Grip: The front and back of the grip are grooved on the 92FS and M9, while the M9A1 and 90-Two feature checkering. The grip frame is flared slightly at the base to enhance pointability and control. 
. High-Capacity Magazines: The 92 family magazines are interchangeable within caliber, and range in capacity from 10 to 20 rounds in 9mm.
92 FS. A LEGENDARY FIREARMS. 
The most tested and trusted personal defense weapon in history.
The 92FS, designated M9 by the U.S. Military, not only meets or exceeds all U.S. Military testing guidelines, it totally rewrites them.
BERETTA U.S.A. RELIABILITY AND DURABILITY STATISTICS FOR THE BERETTA 9mm PISTOL.

title: For Sale:  Franchi SPAS 12 (Special Purpose Automatic Shotgun) NIB Pre-Ban model
postcontent:
Type: selective pump-action or gas-operated
 Gauge: 12
 Chamber: 2 3/4" (70 mm)
 Length: 1041 mm
 Barrel length: 546 mm.
 Weight 4.4 kg
 Capacity: 8 rounds in under barrel tube magazine
 Manufactured from 1988-1990 for US import 


The SPAS-12 was designed by the Italian company Luigi Franchi Spa as a special purpose, military and police close combat weapon (actually, SPAS stands for Sporting Purpose Automatic Shotgun, or Special Purpose Automatic Shotgun, depending on the source). It featured a selective action for greater versatility, and can be used as a gas operated semi-automatic repeater or as a manually operated pump action repeater, depending on the mission and ammunition used. Since its introduction SPAS-12 became a very popular police and special-forces weapon, being versatile, reliable and with good firepower. On the other hand, it is heavier than most other similar shotguns and quite complicated, which results in relatively high prices.

SPAS-12 utilizes somewhat traditional for shotguns gas system with annular gas piston locating around the under barrel magazine tube. It operates the bolt with vertically tilting locking lug that engages the barrel extension to lock.SPAS-12 can be switched between gas operated self-loading mode and manually operated pump mode by pressing and holding a button at the bottom of the forearm and pulling the forearm slightly forward for AUTOMATIC mode or backward for PUMP(or MANUAL) mode. Earlier models of the SPAS-12 had the lever type safety at the front of the trigger guard, but due to some deficiencies this was latter replaced by the push-button (cross-bolt) safety at the same place. 

SPAS-12 could be fitted with stamped metallic butt-stock that folds to the top of the receiver when not in use, and with a pistol grip made of plastic. Alternatively, solid plastic butts-tocks with pistol grips are available. Barrel has cylinder bore with screw-on muzzle devices (cokes of flash hiders). Sights usually are of rifle type, with post front and open notch rear sight.

Additional Charges

IOTV INFO(WIKI)

The IOTV is designed to take the weight of the vest off the shoulders and move it to the lower torso. The vest is also equipped with a mesh inner cover that is designed to improve airflow inside of the armor. There is also a back pad in the lower back area of the vest, which is designed to defeat fragmentation impacts to the lower back/kidney areas. However, the back pad does not provide ballistic protection. The vest can withstand a direct impact from a 7.62 millimeter (both NATO and ex-Soviet types) on the front or rear plates (SAPI NIJ standard III). The soft kevlar panels have been tested to stop 9 mm 124 grain full metal jacket bullets at 1,400 ft/s (426 m/s) with minimal deformation and has a V-50 of roughly 1,525 ft/s (465 m/s). This means that the bullet has to be traveling faster than 1,525 ft/s for it to have more than a 50% chance of breaking through the soft armor panel. These specifications are similar to the NIJ standard level III-A certification, however, military standards do not require their vests to be NIJ certified. This is a huge improvement over the PASGT vest, and the Vietnam era fragmentation vest (which was made of nylon). Both only offered protection against fragmentation.

IOTV VEST MEDIUM

2 LEVEL 4 PLATES
1 FRONT SOFT ARMOR INSERT
1 BACK ARMOR INSERT
1 GROIN PROTECTOR(NOT PICTURED)
1 NECK PROTECTOR 
1 LOWER BACK

title: For Sale:  Action Arms Israeli Military Industries (IMI) Uzi Pistol 45 CP and 9mm conversion kits 9mm Extremely Rare NIB Pre-Ban
postcontent:
Few were manufactured between 1983 to early 1989
 This is the 45CP version with a 9mm conversion and comes in a box with pistol in a hard plastic case, 9mm conversion kit and 1 box of 45CP bullets and 1 box of 9mm bullets
 Description 
Imported by Action Arms the Israeli Military Industries (IMI) Uzi was a revolutionary weapon in that it was the first to use a telescoping bolt design, in which the bolt wraps around the breech end of the barrel. This allows the barrel to be moved far back into the receiver and the magazine to be housed in the pistol grip. The Uzi uses an open bolt, blowback-operated design. The open bolt design exposes the breech end of the barrel, and improves cooling during periods of continuous fire. Used by the Secret Service from the 1960s until the 1990s, the Uzi is known as one of the most compact, yet versatile, personal defense weapons of the past forty years. This Uzi is a new in box pre-ban Pistol Model in 9mm. It's been stored and is in excellent condition. The gun pictured may have a different serial number, but is a NIB Uzi. 
The UZI pistol was developed by Israel Military Industries (now IWI Ltd) during early 1980s from the famous Micro-UZI submachine gun. Intended users for the UZI pistol were various security agencies and services which wanted a high-capacity semi-automatic pistol, and civilian shooters (mostly in USA) which also wanted such gun with "cool Uzi style". Despite somewhat rough appearance UZI pistols were reliable and quite accurate. It also must be noted that 'original' UZI pistols should not be confused with full-size weapons based on semi-automatic only full-size Uzi carbines but without the shoulder stock. 
UZI pistol is blowback-operated semi-automatic weapon which fires from closed bolt. It has a stamped steel receiver and the bolt is fully enclosed inside. Bolt is of 'telescoped' design, that is, it is hollow in the front and encloses the rear part of the barrel when in battery. Uzi pistol has a single action trigger and utilizes an internal sliding striker (firing pin). Manual safety of sliding type, and is located above the grip on the left side of the gun. Magazines are of double stack design, interchangeable with other guns of Uzi family (in 9mm caliber). Sights are of open type, with flip-up rear sight, adjustable for windage.
 Details:
 • Semi-auto carbine
 • 4.5" barrel
 • Baked enamel black finish over phosphated (parkerized) base
 • 25 round mag
 • Original sling
 • Original molded plastic and cardboard boxes
 • Bayonet lug
 • Includes case, cover sleeve, all original literature and accessories
Quick release clip

title: For Sale:  TA31RCO-A4CP: Trijicon ACOG 4x32 Scope with BAC USMC Rifle Combat Optic (RCO) for M16A4 (20" barrel)
location: Northwest Green Bay/Howard, Green Bay, Wisconsin
postcontent:
WARNING: If you don't understand what a COMBAT OPTIC is, or why they are expensive, GO AWAY. This isn't for hunting deer, or squirrels, or other game.

If your rifle is chambered in 5.56mm and is for DEFENDING YOUR LIFE and THE LIVES OF YOUR FAMILY/TEAMMATES, you may have a use for this optic.

I'm sorry, but I just wasted 20 minutes of my life explaining this stuff to someone who I should have known didn't need this based on his questions.

Yeah, REDACTED, I'm talking about you.

THIS IS NOT A NIGHT VISION SCOPE.

This rifle scope has sat on my safe-queen Sig 556 since I bought it a few years ago. It will mount to a rail or to an AR carry handle. It's an excellent optic, and lends great capability to any 5.56/.223 rifle at all ranges thanks to the dual-illuminated reticle and bullet drop compensator. By utilizing the Bindon Aiming Concept, this optic functions as a red dot sight for close range, and a precision 4x scope at longer ranges. After very successful testing of a limited number of these ACOG's early in the Iraq War, the Marine Corps bought an ACOG for every rifle and carbine in their inventory. This is no small matter, since they pay more for each ACOG than they do for the M16's and M4's they put them on!

Manufacturer page for product:
http://www.trijicon.com/na_en/products/product3.php?pid=TA31RCO-A4CP

From that site:

The TA31RCO is an Advanced Combat Optical Gun sight (ACOG) designed for the M16A4 Weapon system (20” barrel). It incorporates dual illumination technology using a combination of fiber optics and self- luminous tritium. This allows the aiming point to always be illuminated without the use of batteries. The Tritium illuminates the aiming point in total darkness, and the fiber optic self-adjusts reticle brightness during daylight according to ambient light conditions. This allows the operator to keep both eyes open while engaging targets and maintaining maximum situational awareness. Designed to the exact specifications of the United States Marine Corps, the unique reticle pattern provides quick target acquisition at close combat ranges while providing enhanced target identification and hit probability out to 800 meters utilizing the Bullet Drop Compensator.



The TA31RCO-A4CP also includes:

1 Thumbscrew Flattop Adapter (TA51)
 1 ACOG Thumb Screw (RCO) (TA53A)
 1 4x32 RCO killFLASH®
1 Adjuster Cap Lanyards
 1 4x32 Scopecoat (TA96)
 1 LENSPEN® (TA56)
 1 Trijicon Logo Sticker (PR15)
 1 RCO Manual
 1 Warranty Card

title: For Sale:  AK-47 sporter RARE! 386 factory code!
postcontent:
Up for consideration is a cool rifle that just came to me.  It is an AK sporter from the You've got a sporterized AK here. I think this one was called the Valley Guns "Hunter." Many of these were imported from China for the commercial US market. It has stamped 386 on the reciver.

The factory 386 code is somewhat more desirable, supposedly being the Poly-Tech factory that made the Chinese military AK along side these. As the Chinese guns go, these are typically very nice. The Chinese AK is a well-made version. Solid weapon. Typical values are $550-$700, maybe a touch higher because or the factory codefactory.  It is made by Norinco, imported to the US around the mid 1980s.  It has the nicesty reciever of any AK I have ever seen.  Checkering on the stick and forgrip as well as sling mounts.  Will take AK mags.  This thing is neat and if you do some research, you will find these are rare.


Email for details, looking to sell or trade.  Looking for other "fun" guns.  Cetme, Glock .45, or a tricked out shotgun?  Let me know what you have worse I can say is no.  Thanks for looking
